text: $AMZN Prime Video now reaches 315M monthly ad-supported viewers worldwide which is up from ~200M last year

SoftBank just closed out its entire $NVDA position, a stake that once made Masayoshi Son one of Nvidia‚Äôs biggest early backers.

They‚Äôre freeing up $30B for new investments & the exit says more about SoftBank‚Äôs need for capital than anything about Nvidia.

$SOFI wants to own the full digital-asset on-ramp.

Crypto inside a regulated bank app lowers their funding costs & keeps users with SoFi instead of leaking to $COIN.

This is a great move because the more financial activity that stays inside SoFi then the more pricing power they gain across lending, investing & payments.
$NBIS JUST LANDED A 5 YEAR, $3B DEAL TO SUPPLY AI INFRASTRUCTURE TO $META

$NBIS reaffirmed its 2025 ARR outlook at $1B & tightened revenue guidance to $500M to $550M for the year.

Management basically said demand is absorbing everything they build & $NVDA Blackwell is pulling customers into longer-term pre-purchase commitments.

$SOFI just brought crypto trading back, becoming the first nationally chartered consumer bank to let members transact BTC, ETH, and SOL directly in-app.

They‚Äôre also moving toward a USD stablecoin by late 2025 which tells you they want to own the full digital-asset on-ramp.

$OKLO just secured DOE approval for the safety design of its Aurora fuel-fab facility, the first sign-off under the DOE‚Äôs new Fuel Line Pilot Projects program.

The DOE cleared it in under two weeks & I honestly didn‚Äôt know nuclear approvals could move that fast.

I don't think people realize how insane the new target of 2.5 GW by the end of 2026 is for $NBIS.

Power is the real constraint on AI expansion since every watt you can deliver to a data center determines how many accelerators you can energize and how much inference you can sell.

Going from a few hundred megawatts to multi gigawatts means Nebius is gearing up to host hundreds of thousands of high end GPUs. 

And once that kind of power infrastructure is in place then it becomes a long term revenue engine. Customers do not walk away from a site that can reliably power and cool their GPU fleets and gives them room to keep scaling through every new hardware cycle. When a provider locks in that environment, the workloads stay, the contracts extend and the economics compound on their own.

$NBIS raising contracted capacity from 1 GW to more than 2.5 GW & guiding to up to 1 GW of connected power by 2026 is a signal that demand visibility is very real. 

Companies do not scale power footprints like this unless they have line-of-sight on long-term GPU deployments.

$NBIS Q3 EARNINGS

‚Ä¢ Sales $146M vs. Est. $156M
‚Ä¢ EPS ($0.40) vs. Est. ($0.52)
‚Ä¢ EBITDA ($5.2M) vs. Est. ($5.8M)
‚Ä¢ Core AI infra grew ~400% YoY & ~40% QoQ

2026 Guidance
‚Ä¢ ARR: $8B
‚Ä¢ Contracted Capacity: 2.5GW

$TSM is accelerating its 2nm expansion in Arizona as $AAPL locks in over half of its 2026 capacity.

2nm is the node that will drive the next wave of AI inference which is why every major chipmaker is now trying to secure allocation before the line is fully spoken for.

Microsoft $MSFT is investing $10 billion on an AI data center hub in Portugal with Nscale, set to host ~12,600 $NVDA GB300 GPUs.

CoreWeave $CRWV said that it added an additional 120MW of power during the quarter, bringing its active power to 590MW, while it expanded its total contracted power to 2.9GW, up from 2.2GW last quarter.

CoreWeave $CRWV reported 134% revenue growth to $1.36 billion, ahead of estimates for $1.28 billion, while GAAP loss of ($0.22) beat estimates for ($0.51). 

Backlog rose 85% QoQ to $55.6 billion.

Big Tech capex surged past $100 billion this quarter to over $113 billion, more than tripling since the start of 2023.

$AMZN $MSFT $META $GOOG $NVDA

Morgan Stanley estimates that the hyperscalers, Meta $META, Oracle $ORCL and CoreWeave $CRWV will spend $700 billion on capex in 2027, up from $591 billion in 2026 and up nearly 3x from $245 billion in 2024.

But strong Q3 earnings beats suggest this isn't the end of the run, just a breather.

Risk-defined strategies help traders stay calm during the pause.
